documents.document: @drkatmclean @sophiescott2 @MelissaSweetDr Thanks - but can I respectfully say that I think dropping a male name here kinda makes ruins the focus. I don't have the right words. However good my intentions, keep the focus on the excellent women communicators for a message like this IMO.
RT @MelissaSweetDr: Male voices dominate the news. Heres how journalists and female experts can turn this around https://t.co/nBWxaRsqQo #
RT @sophiescott2: @MelissaSweetDr And use Twitter to seek out female experts! They are there and amazing
@LukeDashjr That's your response? Dude.

Why don't we have dashboards of domestic violence attacks murders? This is a chronic disease of society. If this was notifiable we'd publicly track it with weekly reports spend lots to identify protect against it. Why don't we care enough? #domesticviolence #DomesticAbuse
@GregDore2 Where were the fines for Italy, the UK and the US by the way? Why now? How many have travelled to and from Australia in the past 16mths?

RT @LindaMottram: After W.H.O. issues new advice that coronavirus is airborne, @rajah_mich says it is "seismic". She explains why it matter
@CathNoakes @PrasadKasibhat1 @microlabdoc Yes that was a popular adaptation of Prof Reason's model.

@judysimpson222 @Brian_Orak @a_chtung @CDCgov It can indeed. And it can persist for quite a time in some cases. Perhaps there's a role for reinvigorating the immune response, among those cases at least?

@CathNoakes @PrasadKasibhat1 @microlabdoc I absolutely didn't. I came far too late to this. I think because I was simply getting my info from the wrong sources. And this wasn't my area of expertise so I missed that.
@throse_gd @Warish73 @DrPieterPeach Warish/Ivy - is this something we can all try to setup?
@richardajabu @Warish73 @CDCofBC Extremely unlikely as cells outside the body are on a path to death
@Warish73 @throse_gd @DrPieterPeach But access can be applied for. Collaborations can be formed. Things can be achieved, despite the extra work.
RT @drvyom: Similar results for both AZ and Pfizer.
@aperfectstrange @richardajabu @CDCofBC Vital antigens I think. Suggested persistent gut infection.
@JeffBullard16 Where is this difference?
@JeffBullard16 No.
@Warish73 @liammannix https://t.co/J3c1xR20Ms
@Warish73 @DrPieterPeach Any ideas why Warish doesnt have access to epi data @throse_gd?
Good piece. But no clear answer (spoiler alert). Pop-up local sample collection for the win? https://t.co/YvqvSqUuVB
RT @macroliter: I disagree with this take. The virus remains SARS-CoV-2, and the disease, COVID-19.

@RidleyDM @kindenough2018 @notdred @Brian_Orak @macroliter But the possibility exists and shouldn't be entirely discounted without more data... "There is a realistic possibility that VOC B.1.1.7 is associated with an increased risk of death compared to non-VOC viruses" https://t.co/1WgdQ8evaN
@RidleyDM @kindenough2018 @notdred @Brian_Orak @macroliter "..nd thus compromised timely access to hospital care" https://t.co/HJfCqtvz7P

@RidleyDM @kindenough2018 @notdred @Brian_Orak @macroliter And it's complex "501Y.V2 variant was associated with in-hospital mortality that was 20% higher in the second wave in South Africa than in the first wave..//..due mainly to the greater transmissibility of this variant, which rapidly overburdened health services.."

@RidleyDM @kindenough2018 @notdred @Brian_Orak @macroliter Not quite that absolute. "We show an increased risk for hospitalisations and ICU admission associated with the SARS-CoV-2 variants" https://t.co/ZkyuhZ8rSf

@WryWryWry3 And if you're a scientist who isn't here to help others learn or to learn yourself, maybe you're actually contributing to the problem, or just have no plan to help the public understand what they *already* find scary overwhelming.

@WryWryWry3 I absolutely have no problem with pointing out suggesting a correction for something that is flat out wrong/wobbly/unclear. My point was we can do that without aggression (esp when an error isn't intentional misinformation). I don't think that way of communicating helps anyone
@Brian_Orak @macroliter And mine. I have some other deleting to do now. Thx.

@macroliter @Brian_Orak Thx. Sorry for sticking my nose in. Can't help myself sometimes-am trying to work on that. I was just trying to say keep the grumpiest responses (which I'm all for btw!) for the true f!$%heads. But I've learned something from this, so all good! /out

@MauritzPreller @TheEliKlein @macroliter I admit I've struggled with what has largely been good content framed in a way that the public will understand (I've overlooked mistakes), versus past deeds I find atrocious - the person vs their expertise. This was a kick in the butt that has helped me coalesce that thinking.
@Brian_Orak @macroliter I'm across that and agree about the person and his actions and his arrest. Should we discard his experienced opinion though?
@TheEliKlein @macroliter Okay. I hear that. I'll withdraw my comments in this thread and give it all some more thought.
@Brian_Orak @macroliter Huh? You're not being called a denier by me.
@Brian_Orak @macroliter Ah, so it's more than some tweets that you're addressing here.
@Brian_Orak @macroliter You're definitely a hero

@Brian_Orak @macroliter Yep. Definitely the way to address these life-threatening concerns. Pull down a useful messenger, in public because of some imperfect tweets. I hope you spend same % of time on those wilfully lying spreading disinformation. Guess not, else you'd have no time for this

@DRTomlinsonEP @DrPieterPeach Jimenez, Marr, Milton and others didn't kill it despite a truckload of engagement in recent months. IMO, it now really needs WHO and each country's major public health institutions to campaign about it.
@DRTomlinsonEP @DrPieterPeach Suppressed or poorly communicated across disciplines or not acted on because too much effort and work...etc
@KurtadikarKetan @macroliter Too much performance pressure

I'd rather call it a taxi than change the syndrome name because of mutations to the causative agent and a fractional change in established patterns of transmission and outcome. We could be calling "flu", influenza 2021.4.x.1 if we adopt this approach https://t.co/PExZiC7pfm
